records.data:
ZenML ML Engineer Discusses AI Tool Failures in Production: Alex Strick van Linschoten, an ML Engineer at ZenML, discussed the reliability cliff of AI agents and what happens when AI tools fail in production, drawing insights from 900+ documented LLM and AI enterprise deployments in ZenML's LLMOps database. The discussion encourages contributing to the LLMOps database to document real-world AI deployments.

Kentro Tech and OKIGU Offer Workshop on AI-Generated Code: Isaac Flath (Kentro Tech, ex-Answer.AI) and Eleanor Berger (OKIGU, ex-Microsoft, ex-Google) are hosting a workshop to teach developers how to break complex problems into smaller tasks, provide clear context to AI tools for better code results, and systematically review AI-generated code before integrating it into projects.

Salesforce's AI Infrastructure Team Contributes to AI System Evaluation: Stefan Krawczyk from Salesforce's AI Infrastructure team co-authored an essay on Decoding AI about Evaluation-Driven Development for AI Systems, focusing on how to escape Proof-of-Concept purgatory.

Manus Develops AI Agents for Conversation Data Summarization: Ivan Leo, an ML Engineer at Manus, will host a session detailing methods for summarizing LLM and agentic conversation data at scale, embedding and clustering conversations to identify recurring patterns, and building classifiers and feedback loops for continuous improvement in AI agents.

NVIDIA Invests $5B in Intel, Co-Developing AI Systems: NVIDIA is making a $5B equity investment in Intel to co-develop x86 CPU + NVIDIA GPU tile systems for rack-scale AI infrastructure and new AI PC SoCs, which broadens CPU compatibility for NVIDIA's rack systems and allows them to capture more of the AI PC market.

Kepler Robotics Begins Mass Production of Humanoid Robots: Kepler Robotics has announced the mass production of its Kepler A40 Hybrid, a humanoid robot using a combined electric-hydraulic architecture, priced around $25,000 to $30,000, representing a large-scale humanoid robot manufacturing effort in China.

Figure AI Unveils Integrated Humanoid Robot for Mass Manufacturing: Figure AI unveiled Figure 03, a fully-integrated humanoid robot designed for mass manufacturing and built on a joint AI system with OpenAI, combining visual perception, reasoning, and manipulation with plans to begin commercial deployment in logistics and manufacturing next year.

Baidu Deploys Kunlun P800 Cluster for LLM Training: Baidu deployed a 30,000-card Kunlun P800 cluster, becoming the first Chinese company operating domestic AI accelerators at hyperscale for LLM training, plus Baidu’s Intelligent Cloud won a 1 billion yuan China Mobile contract for AI inference servers utilizing Kunlun chips.

Poolside Plans 2GW AI Campus in Texas with CoreWeave: AI startup Poolside announced plans to build a 2 Gigawatt AI training campus in West Texas, beginning with a 250MW cluster built with CoreWeave, containing 40,000 NVIDIA GB300 GPUs.

Exo Labs Builds Frankencluster with DGX Spark and Mac Studio: Exo Labs has constructed a 'frankencluster' using an NVIDIA DGX Spark and an Apple Mac Studio, implementing software that distributes computational tasks to each machine based on their strengths, yielding a 2.8X speedup over a Mac Studio baseline for LLM inference.

Meta and Blue Owl Partner for Data Center Construction: Meta is partnering with Blue Owl in a private-capital deal, estimated at nearly $30 billion, to build a hyperscale data center. Meta will retain a 20% ownership stake, offloading the remaining ownership to Blue Owl, aiming to expand its AI infrastructure.

Anthropic Launches Agent Skills for Claude: Anthropic introduced Agent Skills, a new feature that enables Claude to access specialized instructions, scripts, and resources for specific tasks. This allows for modularized expertise that can be loaded on demand, improving performance and enabling specialized capabilities like Excel manipulation or brand guideline adherence across Claude's products.

Google DeepMind Releases Veo 3.1 with Enhanced Video Generation: Google DeepMind launched Veo 3.1, enhancing its AI-powered video creation tool with improved audio, more realistic visuals, and greater creative control. The new version allows users to combine text prompts with reference images and define start and end frames for more directable and continuous video sequences.

Alibaba Qwen Releases Qwen3-VL Models: Alibaba Qwen released Qwen3-VL 4B and 8B, two small models optimized for reasoning and instruction following. The models provide improved capabilities for visual understanding tasks.

Oracle Announces Comprehensive AI Infrastructure and Platform Strategy: Oracle announced a comprehensive AI strategy, highlighting its OCI Zettascale10 infrastructure connecting up to 800,000 NVIDIA GPUs, AI Database 26ai integrating AI directly into the database core, and pre-built AI agents embedded in Oracle Fusion Applications. This positions Oracle as building vertically across infrastructure, platform, and applications in the AI stack.

WorkOS Launches AuthKit Authentication Platform: WorkOS released AuthKit, a complete authentication platform, to handle everything from basic login to enterprise SSO without integrating multiple systems. AuthKit includes a hosted UI, enterprise authentication support, roles and permissions, radar for fraud protection, custom metadata, and Connect for application integrations, aiming to simplify authentication for growing SaaS companies.

Every Studio Launches Spiral, an AI Writer: Every Studio launched Spiral, a reimagined AI writing tool that learns a user's style through interviews and helps draft content in formats from X posts to essays. Spiral focuses on delivering high-quality AI outputs tailored to individual user preferences.

Every's Cora Upgrades to Anthropic's Haiku 4.5 Model: Every's inbox assistant, Cora, has been upgraded to Anthropic's new Haiku 4.5 model, resulting in a 44% faster response time while maintaining accuracy. The upgrade provides quicker and more efficient assistance to Cora users, improving their email management experience.

Sparkle Adds Content-Based Organization Feature: Sparkle introduced a new feature that organizes files based on their content, not just by name or date. Users can now instruct Sparkle to gather files related to a specific topic, and it will scan filenames and document contents to create a dedicated folder, enhancing file management capabilities.

Monologue Launches Teams and Improves Transcription Latency: Monologue, a dictation tool, launched team accounts with self-serve onboarding capabilities and reduced transcription latency for audio over 60 seconds by 50 percent. It also expanded its recording limit to 1.5 hours and transcribes them in just 15 seconds, providing users with faster and more streamlined transcription services.

Anthropic Introduces Claude Skills for Enhanced Model Abilities: Anthropic has released Claude Skills, a new system allowing users to enhance Claude's performance on specific tasks by loading instructions, scripts, and resources. Skills are stored in folders and accessed when relevant, improving Claude's capabilities in specialized areas such as Excel and brand guideline adherence, with examples like document creation now available in Anthropic's repository.

Anthropic Launches Claude Haiku 4.5: Anthropic unveiled Claude Haiku 4.5, a smaller and more affordable AI model in the Claude 4.x series, available to all users including those on the free tier. Haiku 4.5 is designed to be fast and perform well, even outperforming older, larger models on certain tasks, particularly in coding where it matches Claude Sonnet 4 and OpenAI's GPT-5 on bug fixing.

Google's AI Model Generates Validated Cancer Therapy Hypothesis: Google DeepMind's AI model, C2S-Scale 27B, developed in collaboration with Yale, has generated a novel hypothesis regarding cancer cellular behavior that has been experimentally validated in living cells. The model identified a method to transform 'cold' tumors, which are resistant to treatment, into 'hot' tumors responsive to immunotherapy, resulting in a roughly 50% increase in antigen presentation in lab tests.

OpenAI Partners with Broadcom and AMD for Custom AI Chips: OpenAI has partnered with Broadcom to co-design and deploy custom AI accelerators, with the aim of reducing reliance on Nvidia and AMD and achieving major efficiency gains for OpenAI's workloads. The systems, integrating compute, memory, and networking on Broadcom's Ethernet stack, are slated for deployment in late 2026, and AMD granted 160 million shares to support OpenAI’s buildout.

OpenAI's DevDay 2025 Introduces Apps, AgentKit, and More Powerful Models: OpenAI's DevDay 2025 introduced Apps inside ChatGPT, a preview Apps SDK, and AgentKit, re-framing ChatGPT as an app platform and agent OS. Apps run directly in ChatGPT with interactive UIs and actions via the Model Context Protocol (MCP), while new API models include GPT-5 Pro and Sora 2 video, alongside the announcement of 800 million weekly active ChatGPT users.

Google Releases Veo 3.1 with Enhanced Video Generation Capabilities: Google has launched Veo 3.1, an upgraded version of its Veo 3 video generation model, which focuses on improved visual fidelity, stronger prompt adherence, and richer editing controls, with an improvement to image-to-video quality and the introduction of better audio output. This new model, which also offers granular edits and object manipulation, is now available in Flow, the Gemini app, and via Vertex and Gemini APIs.

Microsoft Launches 'Vibe Working' in Excel and Word with Agent Mode: Microsoft has launched 'Agent Mode' in Excel and Word, powered by OpenAI's GPT-5 and an Anthropic-powered Office Agent in Copilot chat, which enables users to generate, plan, and execute complex spreadsheets, documents, and slide decks from simple prompts. The new mode aims to automate complex office tasks using AI agents integrated directly into Microsoft Office applications.

Anthropic Releases Petri, an Open-Source Framework for AI Auditing: Anthropic has released Petri, an open-source framework for automated auditing designed to use AI agents to test the behaviors of target models across diverse scenarios. Petri automates large-scale alignment audits, orchestrating an auditor agent to run multi-turn probes, synthesize realistic environments and tools, and use an LLM judge to score transcripts.

Anthropic Introduces Claude Skills for Workplace Task Automation: Anthropic introduced 'Skills,' enabling organizations to create and share reusable sets of instructions, scripts, and resources that teach Claude to perform specific workplace tasks. These Skills can be integrated across Claude.ai, Claude Code, the API, and the Claude Agent SDK, allowing for customized workplace automation.

Zoox Launches Robotaxi Service in Las Vegas: Amazon's Zoox has launched a free robotaxi service in a mapped, geofenced area along the Las Vegas Strip, accessible via a phone app. Early rider reports have been primarily positive, with no accidents reported, marking a step forward in the deployment of autonomous vehicle technology for public transportation.

Anthropic Launches Agent Skills for Claude: Anthropic has introduced Agent Skills, a modular system enabling Claude to load specialized workflows for tasks like document editing and content creation. These skills, organized as folders with instructions and scripts, are dynamically loaded by Claude and can be stacked for complex tasks and used across Claude apps, Claude Code, and the API, streamlining specialized task automation.

Anthropic Integrates Claude with Microsoft 365 via New MCP Connector: Anthropic is connecting Claude directly to Microsoft 365, enabling data retrieval from SharePoint, OneDrive, Outlook, and Teams through a new MCP framework. This integration allows enterprise users to query across calendars, chats, HR files, and emails, synthesizing results from multiple systems in a single request, enhancing Claude's utility within enterprise environments.

Apple Unveils M5 Chip with Enhanced AI Performance: Apple launched the M5, a next-generation processor for its devices, boasting a 4x increase in GPU compute for AI tasks compared to the M4.  Each GPU core now includes a Neural Accelerator, which enables large AI models to operate locally with greater efficiency, improving on-device Apple Intelligence capabilities.

Google AI Studio Refreshes User Interface: Google AI Studio has received a user interface refresh, combining Chat, GenMedia, and Live functionalities into a single, streamlined environment. This integration simplifies the workflow for users working with multiple AI modalities, allowing for easier access and management of various AI-driven creative processes.

Google DeepMind Partners with Commonwealth Fusion Systems on SPARC: Google DeepMind is collaborating with Commonwealth Fusion Systems to apply AI to plasma control and simulated reactor design for SPARC, a fusion energy project. DeepMind's models will be used to optimize experimental cycles and reduce the computational costs of simulations, which will aid in achieving net energy breakeven.

Spotify's AI DJ Now Accepts Text Requests: Spotify has enhanced its AI DJ feature for premium users, enabling it to process text-based requests in addition to voice commands. This allows users to prompt the AI to play specific genres, moods, or recommend new artists through text, making the AI feel more interactive and responsive to user preferences.

Amazon Launches AgentCore AI agent platform for all businesses: Amazon has launched the general availability of AgentCore, a platform designed to enable businesses to build and deploy AI Agents. Businesses from many domains such as customer support or insurance can build code executioners and chain together a series of actions with many external tools.

Oracle Expands Agentic AI Toolkit for CFOs: Oracle announced its expanded AI offerings for financial officers and professionals, allowing CFOs to leverage internal data and industry benchmarks to create projections and make better-informed decisions. The aim is to augment decision making by identifying anomalies and risks.

General Intuition Raises $134M Seed to Teach Agents Spatial Reasoning: General Intuition secured $134M in seed funding to develop AI models that possess spatial-temporal reasoning abilities. The company is using Medal's dataset of 2 billion video game clips to train agents, enabling them to understand and navigate complex virtual environments.

Kayak Launches an AI Mode for Travel Questions, Search and Bookings: Kayak has introduced an AI mode that allows users to find and book travel by typing questions like 'Find me a family-friendly hotel in Rome with free breakfast,' rather than using search filters. This simplifies the travel planning process through a conversational interface driven by AI.

California Regulates AI Companion Chatbots: California became the first U.S. state to regulate AI companion chatbots by implementing age verification, content warnings, and suicide-prevention protocols. SB 243 takes effect in January 2026 and mandates firms to disclose that chats are AI-generated, shield minors from explicit content, and penalize profits from illegal deepfakes up to $250,000 per offense, shaping AI oversight nationwide.

Nvidia Releases DGX Spark 'Personal AI Supercomputer': Nvidia launched DGX Spark, a compact "personal AI supercomputer" priced at $3,999 that delivers a petaflop of FP4 performance. This system features a GB10 Grace Blackwell Superchip, 128GB of unified memory, and up to 4TB of SSD storage allowing it to handle AI models with up to 200 billion parameters, aimed at democratizing AI compute by placing supercomputing power on individual data scientists' desks.

OpenAI to Allow Mature Content in ChatGPT for Verified Adults: OpenAI will introduce an age-gated "adult mode" in ChatGPT starting December 2025, enabling mature content including erotica for verified users over 18. This move relaxes previously restrictive safety policies and aims to make ChatGPT feel more human and expressive, providing users explicit control over tone and personality.

Walmart Integrates Shopping Directly Into ChatGPT: Walmart partnered with OpenAI to integrate shopping directly into ChatGPT, enabling shoppers to browse, plan, and purchase products using conversational interfaces. The integration leverages OpenAI’s Instant Checkout feature, offering personalized recommendations and seamless purchases within the chat and positions Walmart to compete with Amazon’s AI tools.

Microsoft Adds Copilot-Powered Formula Completion to Excel: Microsoft is integrating Copilot with Excel to provide AI-driven formula suggestions and completion, simplifying complex Excel workflows. This feature assists users in writing and understanding formulas, and will be available for Microsoft 365 subscribers.

OpenAI Launches GPT-5 Search API with Domain Filtering: OpenAI released the GPT-5 Search API, offering a 60% cost reduction and the ability to filter searches by domain. This API enhances search capabilities in Chat Completions and is designed to align with the new Responses web search behavior.

Firefox Integrates Perplexity AI Search Engine: Mozilla has officially integrated Perplexity's AI answer engine as a selectable search option in Firefox, expanding its availability beyond initial test markets. This gives users the option to use Perplexity, known for its AI-driven search summaries, directly within the Firefox browser.

Google Implements Image Generation in Search and Real-Time AI Makeup in Meet: Google integrated Nano Banana, a Gemini 2.5 Flash-based model, across Search, Lens, and NotebookLM, for functionalities like real-time image generation and video overviews. Google Meet now features virtual makeup with real-time face tracking, and Discover offers live trend previews in Search, enhancing search and communications experiences.

Good Start Labs Raises $3.6M to Train AI with Games: Good Start Labs, spun out of Every, raised $3.6 million to generate reinforcement learning data for frontier labs through teaching AI to play games. They are partnering with Bad Cards to train AI models on humor and will launch leaderboards for AI Diplomacy environments, aiming to improve long-term reasoning.

Alibaba Releases Compact Qwen3-VL Models: Alibaba introduced Qwen3-VL 4B and 8B, compact vision-language models, which come in Instruct and Thinking variants and often outperform Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite and GPT-5 Nano.  The models support 256K context expandable to 1M, and “open vocabulary” detection.

Microsoft's AI Experiences CPO advocates for AI as 'universal translator' at work, showcasing 'Researcher' at Microsoft.: Aparna Chennapragada, Microsoft's CPO of AI Experiences, suggests that AI language models can automate translation tasks, potentially flattening traditional management structures; she is building 'Researcher' at Microsoft to provide CEO-level insights to every employee, leveraging internal knowledge and web data to streamline information access and decision-making.

Figure AI Debuts Figure 03 Mass-Production Home Robot for 2026: Figure AI unveiled Figure 03, a humanoid robot designed for home use with capabilities including folding laundry, loading dishwashers, and watering plants; the robot utilizes Figure's Helix AI system, learning tasks by watching humans and incorporating upgraded cameras, tactile sensors, and wireless charging, and the company plans to produce 12,000 robots per year in its new BotQ factory.

OpenAI Launches Sora, a TikTok-Style Mobile App Powered by Sora 2 Model: OpenAI released Sora, an invite-only mobile app powered by the Sora 2 model for generating and remixing short AI videos with embedded user faces; the app rapidly gained popularity, reaching 1 million downloads within five days and becoming the number one app on the Apple App Store.

OpenAI Introduces Instant Checkout and App Integrations within ChatGPT: OpenAI launched Instant Checkout, allowing users to purchase products directly in ChatGPT starting with Etsy and soon Shopify, powered by the Agentic Commerce Protocol co-developed with Stripe; additionally, ChatGPT now supports interactive third-party apps like Booking.com, Spotify, and Canva, accessible within the platform via OpenAI's Apps SDK.

OpenAI and AMD Announce Multi-Year Partnership for AI Chips: OpenAI and AMD have partnered for a multi-year agreement involving 6 GW of AMD Instinct chips, beginning with 1 GW deployments in H2 2026, while AMD issued OpenAI a warrant for up to 10% of its shares tied to deployment milestones, indicating a diversification of OpenAI's AI chip supply chain.

Thinking Machines Lab Co-founder Joins Meta: Andrew Tulloch, co-founder of Thinking Machines Lab, has joined Meta after declining a $1.5 billion offer earlier, marking a notable AI talent acquisition for Meta.

Microsoft Copilot Integrates with Google and Office Products: Microsoft Copilot now supports Google Drive, Gmail, and Outlook, enabling users to search across multiple accounts with natural language queries directly within Windows; Copilot can also create and export content into Word, Excel, PowerPoint, or PDF formats from simple prompts.

xAI Targets AI-Generated Gaming with 'World Models': Elon Musk's AI startup, xAI, is developing 'world models,' AI systems that simulate real-world physics and environments by learning from videos and robotic data, for application in AI-assisted game design, and Musk announced plans to release a 'great' AI-generated game before the end of next year.

Samsung's Tiny Recursive Model (TRM) Achieves High Accuracy on Reasoning Tasks: Samsung introduced the Tiny Recursive Model (TRM), a 7-million-parameter model that outperforms larger models like DeepSeek R1 and Gemini 2.5 Pro on the ARC-AGI benchmark, demonstrating the potential for smaller models with recursive reasoning to achieve high accuracy on challenging tasks.

Wispr Flow Enhances Productivity through AI-Powered Voice Dictation: Wispr Flow offers a voice-based productivity tool that is 4x faster than typing, with AI-driven auto-editing for emails, documents, and code; it is designed to eliminate filler words, correct grammar, and maintain formatting while integrating with Slack, Notion, Gmail, ChatGPT and other popular applications.

Meta Plans Data Center the Size of Manhattan: Meta is planning to construct a new data center equivalent to the size of Manhattan to meet the growing computational demands of AI, indicating the significant infrastructure investment required to support future AI development and deployment.

Samsung's Tiny Recursive Model (TRM) Achieves High Scores on Reasoning Benchmarks: Samsung's 7-million-parameter TRM model has demonstrated impressive performance on ARC-AGI benchmarks, surpassing much larger models with significantly fewer parameters by thinking recursively. This indicates a potential shift towards smaller, edge-capable AI systems that can run locally rather than in large data centers, reshaping deployment economics.

Figure Unveils Scalable Humanoid Robot for Home Use: Figure has introduced its third-generation humanoid robot, F.03, engineered for mass production and intended for residential use, with plans to manufacture up to 100,000 units in four years. The robot features improved hardware, AI integration, and a focus on cost-effective manufacturing techniques like die-casting and injection molding.

DEEP Robotics Introduces All-Weather Humanoid for Industrial Use: DEEP Robotics, a Chinese company, has launched an all-weather humanoid robot designed for outdoor industrial applications, capable of operating in extreme temperatures ranging from -20°C to 55°C. This development underscores China's growing robotics ecosystem and its focus on robust, real-world applications for humanoid robots.

OpenAI's Dev Day Introduces Apps for ChatGPT and AgentKit: OpenAI unveiled Apps for ChatGPT, allowing developers to integrate third-party services directly into the chat interface, along with the Apps SDK and the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to build interactive applications. The company also introduced AgentKit, a modular toolkit with Agent Builder, ChatKit, and Connector Registry, aimed at simplifying the creation, deployment, and testing of AI agents.

OpenAI and AMD Expand Partnership with Chip Supply Deal: OpenAI has expanded its partnership with AMD through a multi-year deal worth billions, where AMD will supply its MI450 series GPUs starting in 2026 for OpenAI's AI infrastructure. This agreement includes warrants for OpenAI to acquire up to a 10% stake in AMD, reflecting the deep integration between model development and compute capacity management.

Musk's xAI Investing Heavily in Supercomputer Infrastructure: Elon Musk's xAI is reportedly expanding its ongoing funding round to $20 billion, with a structure tied to Nvidia GPU purchases, to build a massive supercomputer in Memphis named Colossus 2, equipped with hundreds of thousands of Nvidia chips. The project aims to accelerate AI development and address the growing demand for AI infrastructure, consuming more electricity than all Memphis homes combined.

Google Launches Gemini 2.5 Computer Use Model: Google released the Gemini 2.5 Computer Use model that can interact with websites and apps like a human by clicking, typing, and navigating on its own. This model, built on Gemini 2.5 Pro, aims to provide faster and more accurate agentic capabilities with strong safety features.

Starbucks Uses AI to Personalize Customer Experience and Optimize Supply Chain: Starbucks utilizes its proprietary AI, Deep Brew, to analyze customer data from its mobile app, enabling personalized promotions and new beverage offerings like unsweetened iced teas. Deep Brew also optimizes the supply chain by analyzing weather, local events, and consumer trends to ensure ingredient availability, resulting in significant cost savings and revenue preservation.

Cognixion Integrates BCI with Apple Vision Pro for Communication: Cognixion, a startup developing brain-computer interfaces (BCI), is launching a clinical trial to integrate its EEG-powered headband and AI communication app with the Apple Vision Pro headset. This integration aims to enable people with paralysis and speech disorders to communicate using brain signals and gaze, offering a non-invasive alternative to brain implants.

GPT-5 Pro Sets New Accuracy Record in Compute-Heavy FrontierMath: OpenAI's GPT-5 Pro achieved 13% accuracy in FrontierMath Tier 4, outperforming Gemini 2.5 Deep Think by a single problem in compute-heavy settings. EpochAI Research clarified that OpenAI had access to 28 of the 48 problems, with GPT-5 Pro solving 5 out of 8 problems on the held-out set.

Mila + Microsoft's Markovian Thinking Decouples Reasoning Length from Context Size: Mila and Microsoft introduced Markovian Thinking, a method to train models to 'write state' at fixed boundaries, enabling reasoning with longer token sequences while using less compute. An R1-Distill 1.5B model reasoned up to 24K tokens with an 8K context, outperforming LongCoT-RL trained on full 24K at ~4× lower compute, reducing dependence on extensive context windows.

vLLM Demonstrates Strong Inference Gains with NVIDIA Blackwell Integration: vLLM achieved substantial performance improvements in InferenceMAX by integrating with NVIDIA Blackwell, utilizing over 100 PRs across the stack, FP4/FP8 kernels, asynchronous scheduling, graph fusions, and FlashInfer integration. Speculative decoding and Data + Expert Parallel (DEP) are expected to further enhance throughput by 2–3x, showcasing deep collaboration between the two companies.

Together AI Launches ATLAS, an Adaptive Speculative Decoding System: Together AI unveiled ATLAS, an adaptive speculative decoding system designed to learn from live traffic, reportedly achieving 4x faster performance compared to baseline (500 TPS on DeepSeek‑V3.1). Early reports also suggest that self-adaptive speculators can reduce RL training time by over 60%, indicating a significant increase in inference efficiency.

Alibaba Qwen Releases Qwen3-VL Cookbooks for Multimodal Tasks: Alibaba Qwen launched a set of polished notebooks for local and API use of Qwen3-VL, covering various multimodal tasks like computer use, omni recognition, document parsing/OCR, 3D grounding, video understanding, mobile agents, and spatial reasoning. These cookbooks are designed to simplify the utilization of the model across various applications.

OpenAI's GPT Realtime Mini Offers Scalable Speech-to-Speech Capabilities: OpenAI released GPT Realtime Mini, a speech-to-speech model that is approximately 7x cheaper than the flagship Realtime, reducing time-to-first-audio (TTFA) to 0.81 seconds and doubling context to 32k. Additionally, GPT Realtime Mini adds image input, positioning it for scalable agent applications over WebRTC/WebSocket/SIP.

Microsoft Unveils NVIDIA GB300 NVL72 Cluster for OpenAI: Microsoft and Azure announced the first production NVIDIA GB300 NVL72 cluster for OpenAI, featuring over 4,600 Blackwell Ultra GPUs. Each NVL72 virtual machine integrates 72 GPUs via NVLink Switch fabric, delivering 1.44 exaflops FP4 per VM and facilitating low-precision training and inference using NVFP4 and the NVIDIA Dynamo compiler.

ComfyUI Integrates NVIDIA GPUDirect Storage (GDS) for Running Heavy Models on Low-VRAM GPUs: Developer Maifee integrated NVIDIA GPUDirect Storage (GDS) into ComfyUI, allowing model weights to be streamed directly from NVMe to GPU VRAM, enabling heavy models to run on GPUs with as little as 6 GB VRAM. This integration bypasses CPU/host RAM, improving I/O efficiency by using a zero-copy NVMe→GPU DMA path, though it is currently limited to Linux.

Figure AI Unveils Third-Generation Humanoid Robot, Figure 03: Figure AI launched its third-generation humanoid robot, Figure 03, designed for mass production and featured in Time Magazine’s ‘Best Inventions of 2025’. Figure's new BotQ factory aims to scale production to 12,000 units annually, focusing on home adoption with improved dexterity for carrying out chores.

SoftBank to Acquire ABB's Robotics Arm for $5.4B: SoftBank is set to acquire ABB’s robotics division for $5.4 billion, granting it immediate entry into the growing $75 billion robotics market. The acquisition will add over 7,000 employees and manufacturing facilities to SoftBank’s automation portfolio, enhancing its AI-driven segment.

Figure Unveils Next-Generation Humanoid Robot Figure 03: Figure AI introduced Figure 03, a new humanoid robot designed for home and industrial use with features like dual palm cameras, fingertip sensors, and wireless foot charging. The company plans to produce 12,000 units per year through BotQ.

Google Launches Gemini Enterprise for Workplace AI Automation: Google released Gemini Enterprise, an AI platform that integrates Gemini models, agents, and enterprise data for workplace automation and no-code agent building. The platform features workflow orchestration and deep integration with Workspace, Microsoft 365, and Salesforce.

Reflection AI Raises $2 Billion for Open-Source AI Development: Reflection AI, founded by ex-DeepMind researchers, raised $2 billion at an $8 billion valuation to develop open-source frontier AI models. The company aims to rival OpenAI and Anthropic by building and open-sourcing frontier AI models.

OpenAI's Sora Hits 1 Million Downloads: OpenAI's AI video app Sora has achieved over 1 million downloads in under five days since its iOS launch, surpassing ChatGPT's initial performance. The app generates short videos from text prompts.

Microsoft Deploys NVIDIA GB300 NVL72 Production Cluster for OpenAI: Microsoft announced it has deployed the world's first at-scale production cluster of NVIDIA GB300 NVL72 for OpenAI, and OpenAI's next-generation models will run on this infrastructure.

Samsung Releases Tiny Logic Puzzle Solving AI Model: Samsung released the Tiny Recursive Model, a 7M-parameter open-source model capable of solving logic puzzles better than Gemini 2.5 Pro and o3-mini despite its compact size.

Alibaba's Qwen Releases Cookbooks for Qwen3-VL: Alibaba's Qwen shared cookbooks for deploying Qwen3-VL in diverse use cases, offering resources for applications like document parsing, spatial reasoning, and building multimodal agents, aiming to facilitate broader adoption.

AI21 Labs Releases Jamba Reasoning 3B: AI21 Labs released Jamba Reasoning 3B, a small reasoning model that leads "tiny" reasoning models with 52% on IFBench, demonstrating strong reasoning capabilities in a compact size.

Radical Numerics Releases RND1, a 30B-Parameter Diffusion Language Model: Radical Numerics released RND1, a 30B-parameter sparse MoE DLM, with weights, code, and training details to catalyze research into DLM inference/post-training and a simple AR-to-diffusion conversion pipeline.

Elastic Acquires Jina AI: Elastic acquired Jina AI to deepen multimodal/multilingual search and context engineering in Elastic’s agentic stack, signaling a move to enhance their AI-powered search capabilities.

Samsung's Tiny Recursive Model (TRM) Achieves High Efficiency in Reasoning: Samsung has developed a 7M Tiny Recursive Model (TRM), a reasoning model that outperforms prior 27M HRM on ARC-AGI and Sudoku. This model uses a smaller, single-network design with full backprop through recursion, which improves generalization by reducing the number of layers and swapping self-attention for MLP in fixed-length contexts.

AI21 Labs Releases Jamba Reasoning 3B Model: AI21 Labs launched Jamba Reasoning 3B, a hybrid SSM-Transformer model, boasting speed and accuracy for long context reasoning tasks. It is reported to be 3-5x faster than Llama 3.2 3B and Qwen3 4B at 32K tokens and can achieve up to 64K context, making it available on HF/Kaggle/LM Studio/llama.cpp.

Alibaba Unveils Qwen3 Omni/Omni Realtime for Unified Audio–Video–Text Processing: Alibaba introduced Qwen3 Omni/Omni Realtime, a unified architecture handling audio, video, and text with “Thinker” and “Talker” Mixture of Experts (MoE). Supporting 119 text languages, 19 speech-in, and 10 speech-out, the model achieves notable BigBench Audio scores and features a fast time-to-first-audio output.

Alibaba's Qwen Image Edit 2509 Enables Multi-Image Editing: Alibaba released Qwen Image Edit 2509, allowing multi-image editing, securing a position in the Artificial Analysis Arena. The open-weights model is available on HF, with pricing at $30/1k images on fal/replicate, offering an accessible option for image manipulation.

CoreWeave, W&B, and OpenPipe Launch Serverless RL: CoreWeave, Weights & Biases (W&B), and OpenPipe introduced Serverless RL, allowing faster and cheaper agent training without infrastructure management. Claims include 40% cost reduction and 28% faster wall-clock time compared to self-managed GPUs, with instant deployment via W&B Inference following CoreWeave's acquisition of OpenPipe.

Google AI Studio Adds Voice Coding Feature: Google AI Studio introduced a voice coding feature that enables developers to dictate app changes and features directly, utilizing STT to clean fillers for clearer prompts. This voice-prompt development is meant to streamline the development process.

Stripe Launches New API for AI Builders: Stripe unveiled a new API designed for AI developers to track model pricing changes and safeguard margins, along with the Agentic Commerce Protocol and Shared Payment Tokens. The update also features “Stripe inside Gemini” to facilitate seamless commerce flows.

Anthropic Upgrades Claude Sonnet and Claude Code: Anthropic updated Claude Sonnet to version 4.5, enhancing performance and offering variable reasoning token budgets. Additionally, Claude Code received a design overhaul with a software development kit for building agentic tools, improved context tracking, memory, and checkpoints.

OpenAI and Meta Diversify with New Social Video Networks and Commerce Integrations: OpenAI launched Sora 2, a TikTok-style social video app, while Meta introduced Vibes for Facebook users to create and remix videos. OpenAI also released ChatGPT Pulse for personalized briefings and Instant Checkout for in-chat shopping via Stripe's Agentic Commerce Protocol.

Alibaba Expands Qwen3 Family with Larger and Smaller Multimodal Models: Alibaba added Qwen3-Max, a closed-weights 1 trillion parameter model, and open-weights Qwen3-VL-235B-A22B for vision-language tasks and Qwen3-Omni for audio-video-text processing. The Qwen3-Omni-30B-A3B stands out as a top-performing open-weights voice model, outperforming GPT-4o on certain benchmarks.

Google DeepMind's Gemini 2.5 Computer Use Model Launch: Google DeepMind released Gemini 2.5 Computer Use, a specialized AI model that can interact with web and mobile UIs like a human, clicking buttons and filling forms, designed for web navigation and mobile app control. The model, available via AI Studio and Vertex AI, operates in a screenshot-action loop and requests user approval before high-risk actions.

OpenAI Releases Apps SDK and AgentKit: OpenAI launched the Apps SDK, enabling developers to build login-enabled applications that run directly inside ChatGPT, with Zillow, Canva, Coursera, and Spotify as early partners, which integrates the Agentic Commerce Protocol to allow developers to monetize in-chat apps. It also introduced AgentKit, providing tools for developers to build, deploy, and optimize AI agents.

xAI Launches Grok Imagine v0.9: xAI launched Grok Imagine v0.9, an AI model designed to generate videos and images with sound, promises faster production times, with standard videos ready in 15-20 seconds. It also incorporates a new voice-first interface enabling hands-free video generation.

Anthropic Integrates with IBM and Expands Globally: Anthropic is partnering with IBM to integrate Claude into IBM's enterprise software, beginning with tools for developers, and will guide responsible AI deployment. To support enterprise adoption, Anthropic is also opening its first office in India and plans to triple its global workforce.

Supermemory AI Raises $3M Seed Round: Supermemory AI, an AI memory startup founded by Dhravya Shah, secured $3 million in seed funding led by Susa Ventures and Browder Capital, with participation from angel investors from Google and Cloudflare. The company is currently hiring across engineering, research, and product as they already serve hundreds of enterprises.

DeepMind Introduces CodeMender for Code Vulnerability Repair: Google DeepMind introduced CodeMender, an autonomous agent using Gemini Deep Think models, designed to find and patch code vulnerabilities with static and dynamic analysis and validation using an internal "LLM judge." It automatically repaired 72 open-source vulnerabilities in testing, hardening the libwebp image library.

Figure AI to reveal its next humanoid, Figure 03: Figure AI plans to reveal its next humanoid, Figure 03, on 10/9. The new version incorporates a protective, clothing-like waterproof outer shell intended to simplify cleaning vs. exposed joints and to protect surfaces from abrasion/scratches, suggesting a trend toward more integrated exteriors across iterations.

Bagel.com Unveils Decentralized Diffusion Model "Paris": Bagel.com unveiled "Paris," a diffusion model trained without cross-node synchronization, and releasing weights (MIT) and a full technical report for research and commercial use. Community framed it as a move toward open-source superintelligence, inviting replication and scale-out experiments on independent nodes.

OpenAI launches ChatGPT Pulse to proactively write you morning briefs: OpenAI launched ChatGPT Pulse to proactively write you morning briefs, using GPT-5 to sift and extract key information from the internet. The tool builds upon the pre-existing GPT infrastructure, allowing for faster and more efficient summary generation.

Adaption Labs launched to target continuously learning, adaptive AI systems: Sara Hooker launched Adaption Labs, targeting continuously learning, adaptive AI systems. The venture is hiring globally across engineering, operations, and design, with a focus on building adaptive product loops.

OpenAI Launches AppsSDK for ChatGPT: OpenAI launched AppsSDK, enabling third-party developers to build interactive apps directly within ChatGPT, potentially transforming ChatGPT into a comprehensive application platform; these apps can support custom UIs and integrate data using MCP. Launch partners include Canva, Zillow, Coursera, and Spotify, allowing users to access these services without leaving the ChatGPT interface.

OpenAI Introduces AgentKit for AI Agent Development: OpenAI released AgentKit, a no-code toolkit for building, deploying, and evaluating AI agents within the OpenAI ecosystem, consisting of Agent Builder, ChatKit, a Connector Registry, and built-in evaluations. AgentKit facilitates the creation of complex, multi-agent systems, streamlines AI operations, and simplifies business process automation, enabling both developers and business users to design and deploy agentic workflows efficiently.

Codex Now Generally Available with New Features: OpenAI's coding agent, Codex, is now generally available to ChatGPT Plus, Pro, Team, and Enterprise users, providing AI-assisted code writing, debugging, and reviewing capabilities. New features include a Slack integration, enabling users to assign coding tasks via tagging `@Codex`, and a Codex SDK for custom workflows, aiming to improve code review and CLI/IDE workflows for enterprise companies.

OpenAI Partners with AMD for AI Compute Infrastructure: OpenAI and AMD announced a multi-year partnership to deploy AMD Instinct GPUs for AI computing, with AMD supplying six gigawatts of processors to OpenAI, commencing with a one-gigawatt rollout in late 2026. The agreement grants OpenAI warrants for up to 160 million AMD shares contingent on deployment and pricing milestones, highlighting a strategic move to diversify compute resources and potentially acquire a significant equity stake in AMD.

DeepMind Unveils CodeMender for Automated Code Security: Google DeepMind introduced CodeMender, an AI-powered agent utilizing Gemini models to autonomously detect and patch code vulnerabilities in software repositories, contributing 72 high-quality fixes to major open-source projects. CodeMender represents Google's effort to bolster AI-driven cybersecurity and set secure-by-design principles for autonomous agents.

Replit Launches Connectors for Tool Integration: Replit introduced Connectors to allow developers to seamlessly link their apps to services like Google, Salesforce, and Notion, through one-click logins without the hassle of managing credentials or repeated setups. This feature allows for easier access to third-party data from within Replit development environments.

Anthropic Open-Sources Petri for AI Auditing: Anthropic has open-sourced Petri, a scenario-driven toolkit used internally for alignment auditing and adapted by AISec Institute for external assessments of sycophancy and deception in AI models. Petri facilitates more comprehensive AI evaluation strategies.

Figure Humanoid Robots Deployed on BMW Production Line: Figure, a robotics company, reported that its humanoid robots have been operating on a BMW X3 body shop production line for five months, running approximately 10 hours per day on each production day. This is reported as being a first sustained humanoid deployment in automotive manufacturing. 

Meta Signs Infrastructure Deal with CoreWeave: Meta has signed a $14 billion infrastructure deal with CoreWeave, a cloud provider specializing in GPU compute, to support Meta's AI initiatives. This deal, coupled with OpenAI's existing partnership with CoreWeave, highlights the growing demand and investment in specialized AI infrastructure.

Supermemory Raises $2.6M for LLM Memory API: Supermemory, a startup founded by a 19-year-old, raised $2.6M from executives at Google, DeepMind, and OpenAI to develop a universal memory API that helps AI retain context between sessions. Supermemory's API addresses the challenge of maintaining conversational memory in AI applications.

OpenAI Launches Sora 2 and Sora App with IP Protection Measures: OpenAI launched Sora 2, an upgraded video generation model, along with its dedicated social video app. The app includes 'Cameo,' a feature that lets users license their likeness for AI content, and adds visible/invisible watermarks to address deepfake concerns.  Due to copyright issues, OpenAI is shifting to full opt-in for IP owners, who will gain controls to manage their content use in Sora.

OpenAI Integrates Instant Checkout into ChatGPT: OpenAI is rolling out Instant Checkout in ChatGPT, allowing users to directly purchase from Etsy sellers within the chat interface. Powered by Stripe's Agentic Commerce Protocol, this feature aims to expand to Shopify merchants, enabling a more seamless shopping experience where AI assists in product selection and completes transactions without leaving the conversation.

OpenAI Readies 'Agent Builder' Tool for Simplified AI Agent Creation: OpenAI is rumored to unveil 'Agent Builder,' a no-code tool for creating AI agent workflows, at its DevDay event. This platform could enable users to design autonomous agents visually, connecting logic blocks, MCP connectors, and file search modules without requiring coding skills.

Alibaba Cloud Announces Global Data Center Expansion: Alibaba Cloud is expanding its data center infrastructure globally, with new facilities planned for Brazil, France, and the Netherlands, along with additional centers in Mexico, Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Dubai. This expansion supports Alibaba's growing AI capabilities and aims to meet rising global demand for AI infrastructure.

Google Releases Jules Tools CLI for Coding Agent Management: Google has launched Jules Tools, a command-line interface and API for managing its coding agent directly from the terminal. This allows developers to run, monitor, and automate coding tasks, integrating the agent into existing workflows and improving control over its operation.

CoreWeave Secures $14 Billion AI Cloud Infrastructure Deal with Meta: CoreWeave has secured a $14.2 billion agreement to provide Meta with AI cloud infrastructure, following a prior $22.4 billion partnership with OpenAI. This deal highlights Meta's heavy investment in AI and its expansion of data centers, like the planned Hyperion supercluster, to enhance its computing capabilities.

Thinking Machines Lab Launches Tinker for Fine-Tuning AI Models: Thinking Machines Lab, founded by former OpenAI employees, has released Tinker, a tool designed to automate infrastructure for fine-tuning AI models like Llama and Qwen. Tinker simplifies fine-tuning via API calls, enabling researchers and companies to customize models for various applications.

CoreWeave Stock Jumps After $14 Billion Deal with Meta: Shares of CoreWeave experienced a nearly 12% increase after the company announced its agreement to provide Meta with $14.2 billion worth of AI cloud infrastructure. This agreement follows CoreWeave's expanded partnership with OpenAI to $22.4 billion and showcases the growing demand for AI infrastructure.

Retro Biosciences Aims to Extend Healthy Lifespan with $180 Million Backing: Retro Biosciences, founded by Joe Betts-LaCroix and backed by $180 million from Sam Altman, is developing treatments to extend healthy human life by 10 years.  The company is working on interventions like an autophagy-based drug for Alzheimer's and methods to rejuvenate the immune system.

Meta to Acquire Chip Startup Rivos for AI Chip Development: Meta intends to acquire Rivos, a chip startup specializing in RISC-V technology, to enhance its internal AI chip development. The acquisition will allow Meta to further develop its Meta Training and Inference Accelerator (MTIA) chips and reduce its reliance on Nvidia.

OpenAI Releases Sora 2 with Enhanced Physical Accuracy and Cameos Integration: OpenAI has launched Sora 2, its latest video generation model, featuring realistic physics simulations and the ability to integrate user likenesses into scenes via a new iOS app. This release marks a significant advancement in AI-generated video quality, making it almost indistinguishable from real footage, and is being rolled out in the U.S. and Canada initially.

Anthropic's Claude Sonnet 4.5 Claims Top Coding Model Spot: Anthropic's Claude Sonnet 4.5 is now recognized as a leading coding model, achieving an 82.0% score on SWE-bench Verified and improved performance on OSWorld, all while maintaining previous pricing. The release also includes a Claude for Chrome extension for browser integration and a Slack integration for workspace communication, extending Claude's utility across various platforms.

Synthesia 3.0 Introduces Interactive AI Video Agents: Synthesia unveiled version 3.0 of its AI video platform, featuring Video Agents that talk, listen, and respond in real-time, turning passive viewing into active conversations. The update also introduces Express-2 Avatars with natural gestures and Veo 3 integration for B-roll footage, enhancing the personalization and interactivity of AI-generated video content.

Thinking Machines' Tinker Simplifies Post-Training Model Tuning: Thinking Machines' Tinker offers a new API/SDK that streamlines post-training by allowing teams to use custom datasets, losses, schedulers, and RL/SL recipes while outsourcing distributed training management. Tinker aims to standardize the process from research paper to policy-compliant model by using open-weights bases like Llama, Qwen, and MoE variants.

DeepSeek-V3.2-Exp Normalizes Sparse Attention for Long Contexts: DeepSeek AI's DeepSeek-V3.2-Exp introduces sparse attention to improve efficiency with long contexts by routing interactions through a structured sparsity pattern, reducing FLOPs and memory usage. This enhancement enables more documents to be processed, increases tokens per second per GPU, and improves economics for agents that use large evidence windows.

Periodic Labs Launches with $300M Seed for AI-Driven Scientific Discovery: Periodic Labs, founded by alumni from top labs, emerges from stealth with $300M in seed funding to develop an AI-native, closed-loop stack for scientific discovery. Their platform integrates foundation models for proposing candidates or protocols, robotic labs for execution, and feedback signals for real-time model updates, aiming to accelerate workflows in materials, chemistry, and biology.

Microsoft Releases Agent Framework for Multi-Agent Systems: Microsoft has launched Agent Framework, a new platform designed for building and managing multi-agent systems, enabling developers to create sophisticated applications that leverage the collaborative capabilities of multiple AI agents.

IBM's watsonx Orchestrate Reduces Recruitment Time by 60%: IBM reports that its watsonx Orchestrate AI tool has significantly improved HR efficiency, reducing the time required to fill new positions by 60%. This improvement is attributed to streamlined recruitment processes and faster candidate feedback, showcasing AI's impact on HR operations within IBM itself.

Databricks Integrates OpenAI Models Natively with Agent Bricks: Databricks is set to natively integrate OpenAI models across its platform as part of a $100 million initiative called Agent Bricks, aimed at accelerating the adoption of enterprise agents by providing seamless access to advanced AI capabilities within the Databricks ecosystem.

Alex Raises $17M for AI Recruiting Platform: Alex, an AI recruiter platform, secured $17M in funding to automate first-round interviews and candidate screenings for large employers, streamlining the initial stages of the hiring process with AI-driven tools.

Anthropic Appoints New CTO: Anthropic announced the appointment of a new CTO, signaling a shift in leadership and potentially influencing the company's technological direction and AI development strategies. The specific identity and background of the new CTO were not detailed, but the appointment itself is a noteworthy event for the company.

Anthropic Releases Claude Sonnet 4.5: Anthropic launched Claude Sonnet 4.5, highlighting its cybersecurity strengths and defensive capabilities, positioning it as comparable or superior to Opus 4.1 on specific cybersecurity tasks. However, some initial hands-on reviews indicate that its coding capabilities are similar to Opus 4.1 and not as capable as GPT-5 Codex, while ChatGPT Team offers better value per dollar than Claude Max for coding tasks.

xAI's Grok Code Fast Claims Higher Edit Reliability: xAI claims its Grok Code Fast model achieves higher diff edit success rates than Claude 4.5 and GPT-5 Codex at a lower cost, suggesting potential advantages in code editing reliability. Independent verification is needed to confirm these claims, but it indicates a focus on edit reliability as a key benchmark for coding agents.

Google's Jules Coding Agent Launches Public API: Google introduced a public API for its Jules coding agent, transforming it into a programmable team member with CI/CD integration capabilities. This API allows developers to integrate Jules into their workflows and tools, making it a more versatile and accessible coding assistant.

Naming Taxonomy Clarity from Qwen Model Families: Qwen provided a taxonomy of its model families, including LLM, Coder, VL, Omni, and Image, as well as instruct vs. thinking variants, and API tiers Max/Plus/Flash, offering clarity for users. This helps developers understand the different models and their intended use cases.

OpenAI's Sora 2 Pro Released with New Features: OpenAI released Sora 2 Pro, their video generation model, which has quickly risen to the #1 spot in the App Store, with high-quality 15-second clips being rolled out. Early tests indicate that Sora 2 can answer GPQA-style questions at approximately 55%, compared to GPT-5 at 72%, possibly due to an LLM prompt rewrite layer before video generation.

Meta Launches Vibes AI Video Feed: Meta launched Vibes, an AI video feed within the Meta AI app, in partnership with MidJourney and Black Forest Labs. The app allows for native image to video generation with a restyle option and music addition, and it links to Instagram, allowing remixes of 'Vibes' videos on the feed.

ZhipuAI's GLM 4.6 Excels in Tool Use: ZhipuAI's GLM-4.6 is reported to have consistently strong user feedback on agentic autonomy and high tool/function-call accuracy, outperforming alternatives like Claude Sonnet and GPT variants in production use. The recommendation is to evaluate tool use via the Berkeley Function-Calling Leaderboard BFCL v4.

Sakana AI Partners with Daiwa Securities: Sakana AI signed a multi-year deal with Daiwa Securities worth approximately ¥5B (~$34M) to jointly develop a 'Total Asset Consulting Platform'. Sakana AI's models will be used for research generation, market analysis, and portfolio construction within the platform.

Perplexity AI Releases Comet Browser to General Availability: Perplexity AI released the AI-first Comet Browser to the general public, making it free and accessible at perplexity.ai/comet. Comet enables parallel agentic tasks, signaling a move towards broader accessibility of enterprise-grade AI tools.

Every to Host Claude Code Camp III Workshop: Every is hosting a live expert workshop, Claude Code Camp III, for its paid subscribers. The workshop will demonstrate how Every's team uses Claude Code for research, expense management, marketing documentation, data analysis, and task automation, offering practical insights for attendees.

Kling 2.5 Turbo Leads in Text-to-Video and Image-to-Video Generation: Kling's latest model, Kling 2.5 Turbo, surpasses competitors like Google's Veo 3 and Luma Ray 3 in both text-to-video and image-to-video categories, generating clips up to 1080p resolution. Kling's offering notable economics, with lower costs per minute compared to alternatives available via FAL API and through Kling’s Ultra plan via app credits.

Google Gemini 2.5 Flash Image ('Nano Banana') Generally Available: Google’s Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, also known as 'Nano Banana,' is now production-ready, offering developers 10 aspect ratios, multi-image blending, and image-only output. Integrated into products like Cartwheel, it's priced at $0.039 per image via the Gemini API on AI Studio or Vertex, with a cost of $30 per 1M output tokens for scaling.

IBM Releases Granite 4.0 Hybrid Mamba/Transformer Models: IBM has launched Granite 4.0, a family of open-weight models combining Mamba and Transformer architectures for improved memory efficiency and token efficiency, available under the Apache 2.0 license. The models, including variants like H Small, H Tiny, and H Micro, are available on HuggingFace and Replicate, with runnable images released by Ollama, and benchmarks placing H Small ahead of Gemma 3 27B on the Artificial Analysis Intelligence Index.

Thinking Machines' Tinker API Facilitates LoRA Sharing for Fine-Tuning: Thinking Machines has launched Tinker, a flexible fine-tuning API that allows users to write CPU-only training loops and run them on distributed GPUs, supporting open models like Llama and Qwen, including large MoE models. Tinker enables efficient resource sharing through LoRA and manages scheduling, resource allocation, and failures.

LlamaIndex Integrates Semantic Search into CLI Agents: LlamaIndex’s SemTools benchmark demonstrates that agents leveraging semantic search provide more complete answers than agents using CLI tools alone when querying a corpus of arXiv papers. SemTools integrates parsing and semantic search directly into command-line agents, compatible with Claude and Gemini CLIs.

Goodfire Open-Sources Scribe for Notebook Execution via MCP: Goodfire has open-sourced Scribe, an MCP-based system that allows agents to execute notebook cells and receive Jupyter outputs, including text, errors, and images. Goodfire also shares insights on structuring scientific workflows, differentiating between 'experimenter agents' and 'software development agents'.

Perplexity's Comet Browser Now Generally Available with Premium Features: Perplexity has announced the general availability of its Comet browser, offering a free version and launching Comet Plus alongside partnerships with major publishers, with Pro/Max users receiving Plus bundled. Comet is promoted as an 'AI browser' and has a feature that is a 'background AI assistant'.

OpenAI Valuation Reaches $500 Billion: OpenAI has become the world's most valuable private company with a valuation of $500 billion following a secondary stock sale, surpassing SpaceX, although the company is still operating at a loss. Concurrent to this growth is the continued success of the Sora App, having a viral uptake with 56,000 day-one downloads, while also integrating profile customization to ChatGPT.

Microsoft to Shift to Unified Agent Framework: Microsoft is retiring AutoGen and Semantic Kernel, consolidating agent development into a unified Agent Framework, an open-source engine for intelligent AI Agents. The new framework consolidates multi-agent orchestration, OpenAPI integration, cross-runtime messaging, and local testing, with built-in governance features, prompt injection shielding, task adherence checks, and PII detection which is core to their offering.

Thinking Machines Lab Launches Tinker API for LLM Fine-Tuning: Thinking Machines Lab, co-founded by ex-OpenAI CTO Mira Murati, has launched Tinker, a managed API for fine-tuning open-weight language models. Tinker enables researchers to maintain algorithmic and data control while offloading infrastructure management.  It supports models like Llama-3.x and Qwen3-235B and provides basic functions for customizing training loops.

OpenAI Releases Sora 2 with Social Media App and "Cameos" Feature: OpenAI announced Sora 2, which features improved realism, physics adherence, native speech generation, and a new iOS app for sharing and remixing AI videos. A new “cameos” feature allows users to insert verified likenesses into videos with consent revocation.  The app is initially invite-only in the U.S. and Canada due to compute constraints.

Meta Launches 'Vibes,' a Short-Form AI-Generated Video Feed: Meta launched Vibes, a short-form video feed on Instagram and Facebook dedicated entirely to AI-generated videos. Early examples utilize partner models from Midjourney and Black Forest Labs while Meta develops its in-house capabilities. However, the launch has drawn user criticism, with many labeling the feature as “AI slop.”

Anthropic Integrates Claude AI with Slack: Anthropic enabled a direct integration of Claude AI within Slack, allowing users to draft messages, summarize discussions, prepare meetings, and analyze documents while respecting existing permissions. Claude is accessible via the Slack Marketplace, either directly or through connected Claude apps, enhancing workplace productivity.

Microsoft's New AI Agents for Word, Excel, and PowerPoint: Microsoft added AI agents to Word, Excel, and PowerPoint through the Frontier program, enabling Copilot to generate analyses, formulas, formatted documents, and PowerPoint presentations from natural language prompts. The agents support cross-file updates, data visualizations, and validation steps, enhancing productivity within Microsoft 365.

Google Previews Gemini-Powered Home Speaker and Nest Cameras: Google previewed a Gemini-powered Home speaker for spring 2026 that offers natural conversations and Matter hub compatibility. It also launched Gemini-powered Nest cameras and a doorbell featuring 2K resolution and contextual alerts, while replacing Google Assistant with Gemini AI in its Home app for faster performance and natural language controls.

LandingAI's Agentic Document Extraction (ADE) Turns PDFs into LLM-Ready Text: LandingAI announced ADE, a tool that converts PDF files into LLM-ready markdown text with high accuracy by iteratively decomposing documents. ADE, powered by the Document Pre-trained Transformer (DPT) model, is intended for use in sectors including healthcare, financial services, logistics, and legal, where accurate data extraction from complex documents is critical.

OpenRouter Offers Million Free BYOK Requests: OpenRouter announced that it will be giving all users 1,000,000 free Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) requests per month, with overages charged at the standard 5% fee, starting October 1, 2025. This move is intended to reduce costs for teams that front their own model keys, while also preserving flexibility.

Hugging Face Introduces Local-First Tracking Tool Trackio: Hugging Face introduced Trackio, a local-first and free tool designed to replace Weights & Biases. Trackio supports the local logging of metrics, tables, images, and videos, offering enhanced privacy and reproducibility for research and enterprise applications.

RapidFire AI Releases Open Source Software for Efficient Model Training: RapidFire AI released an open-source software tool designed for efficient model training. The tool enables 20x more experiments using the same resources, even on a single GPU, and supports hyper-parallel configurations with live control and automatic orchestration.

OpenAI Launches Sora 2 and TikTok-Style Social App: OpenAI released Sora 2, a next-generation video generation model featuring synchronized audio and improved physics, alongside a social app. The Sora app, with a TikTok-style feed, includes a 'cameo' feature allowing users to insert their likeness into generated scenes and share them with friends, initially available in the US and Canada via invite.

Anthropic's Claude Sonnet 4.5 Focuses on Sustained Coding and Enterprise Tooling: Anthropic launched Claude Sonnet 4.5, emphasizing sustained coding capabilities, capable of maintaining focus for over 30 hours. In addition to model enhancements, Anthropic also shipped checkpoints for pausing long tasks, a VS Code extension, terminal controls, context editing, and a memory tool, all aimed at improving the enterprise development experience.

Google DeepMind's Veo 3 Demonstrates Emergent Zero-Shot Vision Abilities: Google DeepMind positioned Veo 3 as a visual counterpart to LLMs, demonstrating zero-shot capabilities across 60 visual tasks without specific tuning. Veo 3 showcased early signs of chain-of-frames reasoning, solving visual logic tasks using temporal cues.

Meta Acquires Rivos to Strengthen AI Chip Development: Meta acquired Rivos, a RISC-V chip startup, aiming to bolster its AI hardware development capabilities and reduce reliance on external GPU suppliers. The acquisition signals Meta's intent to gain more control over its silicon supply chain for AI infrastructure.

Periodic Labs Raises $300M Seed Round to Automate Scientific Experiments: Periodic Labs, founded by ex-OpenAI and DeepMind researchers, secured a $300 million seed to develop AI scientists autonomously conducting physical experiments in robotic labs. The company seeks to accelerate scientific discovery, beginning with superconductors, by generating fresh data for LLMs.

Microsoft Integrates 'Agent Mode' into Office Apps: Microsoft introduced 'Agent Mode' to Excel, enabling automated data analysis, model building, and results validation, previously reserved for advanced users. Similarly, Word gains Agent Mode for drafting, summarizing, and refining documents, while Office Agent automates the creation of polished PowerPoint presentations and Word reports directly from chat.

Zhipu AI Released GLM-4.6 with 200K Context Window: Zhipu AI has released GLM-4.6, featuring a 200K context window, stronger coding, improved reasoning/tool use, and better agent task success, while using fewer tokens per trajectory compared to 4.5. Evaluation details are open, showing GLM-4.6 near-parity to Claude Sonnet 4 in coding.

DeepSeek Cuts API Pricing in Half with New Model: DeepSeek has launched its new V3.2-Exp model, reducing API pricing by half to less than 3 cents per 1M input tokens. The new model is available for open weights and the company claims it retains the same performance as previous models.

Wan-Alpha Framework Generates Transparent Videos: Wan-Alpha proposed a framework that generates transparent videos (RGBA) by encoding the alpha channel into the RGB latent space using a VAE. Training a diffusion transformer enables rendering fine details such as hair strands, and the project includes code, models, and tooling.

Nothing Phone 3 to Include AI App Creation: The next update to the Nothing Phone 3 will reportedly allow users to create new apps with AI. No details were given about which AI would be used or the full capabilities, but this signals a potential move towards simpler app development.

Anthropic Released Claude Sonnet 4.5 with Enhanced Coding Capabilities: Anthropic's Claude Sonnet 4.5 is introduced as a leader in coding benchmarks, featuring enhanced capabilities in computer use, reasoning, and mathematics. The release includes Claude Code checkpoints, a Chrome extension, and the Claude Agent SDK for developers to build versatile agents, emphasizing improved agent loops and flexible tool design.

OpenAI Enables Direct Purchases in ChatGPT: OpenAI has launched 'Instant Checkout,' allowing users to purchase Etsy products directly within ChatGPT conversations, with Shopify integration soon to follow. This feature runs on the Agentic Commerce Protocol (ACP), enabling seamless commerce between AI agents and merchants, opening the platform for wider merchant integrations.

Microsoft Intoduces 'Agent Mode' to Office Suite: Microsoft is enhancing its 365 Copilot with 'Agent Mode,' enabling the AI to handle entire projects autonomously in applications like Excel and Word. This upgrade transforms Copilot from a chatbot to an AI assistant capable of complex tasks, supported by the integration of Claude 4.5 within Copilot Studio.

Google's Gemini Enhances Speed and Efficiency: Google's Gemini has updated its 2.5 Flash and 2.5 Flash Lite models to be significantly faster and more efficient in token usage. The updated Flash model is reported to perform on par with the o3 on internal benchmarks while being cheaper and faster.

OpenAI's Plans for TikTok-Style AI Video App: OpenAI is reportedly developing a social app based on its Sora 2 video model, featuring a vertical, swipeable feed exclusively for AI-generated clips. The app will limit videos to 10 seconds and prohibits personal uploads, creating a social environment centered around AI-generated content.

Alibaba's Qwen Aims for 100M Token Context Window: Alibaba unveiled their Qwen roadmap targeting a context window growth from 1M to 100M tokens and a parameter count from ~1T to 10T for their Qwen model. The roadmap also highlights unbounded synthetic data generation and expanded agent capabilities, signaling a "scaling is all you need" strategy.

DeepSeek Sparse Attention Reduces API Costs: DeepSeek Sparse Attention (DSA) was released with efficiency wins allowing for API price cuts of 50%+. DeepSeek released an experimental V3.2-Exp model that retrofits V3.1-Terminus with a learned sparse attention scheme, cutting long-context costs without quality loss.

Beehiiv Implements Project Golden Flow to Improve User Conversion: Beehiiv implemented 'Project Golden Flow' to enhance the new user experience, aiming to increase conversion rates. Changes include a redesigned signup page with Google SSO, a shorter and personalized onboarding process, targeted email communications, and a revamped dashboard experience with a checklist and resource section.

Fenghua No.3 GPU Claims CUDA and DirectX Support: China's Fenghua No.3 discrete GPU claims support for modern graphics APIs such as DirectX 12, Vulkan 1.2, OpenGL 4.6 and advertises CUDA support. It is unclear if this CUDA support relies on a compatibility/translation layer, so the coverage and perf remain unknown.

Model Evaluation & Threat Research Finds AI Coding Tools Slow Down Software Engineers: The METR team found software developers were slower when using AI tools, tasks were completed 20% slower when using AI. Study participants were randomly assigned to coding tasks with or without AI tools.

OpenAI Announces $300 Billion Cloud Computing Deal with Oracle: OpenAI signed a five-year agreement with Oracle to purchase $300 billion worth of cloud computing capacity, starting in 2027, to secure the compute power needed to scale ChatGPT and other models. This deal will provide OpenAI with 4.5 gigawatts of computing power under the Stargate umbrella, reducing its exclusive reliance on Microsoft Azure.

OpenAI's Letter of Intent for $100 Billion Nvidia AI Datacenters: OpenAI and Nvidia announced a strategic partnership in a letter of intent, under which Nvidia will provide up to $100 billion in funding, released in $10 billion tranches for each gigawatt of capacity that comes online, to deploy 10 gigawatts of next-generation AI datacenters built around millions of Nvidia’s GPUs, starting in the second half of 2026.

OpenAI's Project Stargate Underway: OpenAI's Stargate project, a multi-gigawatt AI infrastructure, is under construction with Oracle and Crusoe Energy in Abilene, Texas, aiming to provide 1.1–1.2 GW with eight data-hall buildings housing over 400,000 GPUs. Five additional Stargate sites in the US are planned, and also overseas initiatives: Stargate UAE, Stargate Norway, and Stargate UK.

Oracle in Talks for $20 Billion AI Cloud Computing Deal with Meta: Oracle is reportedly in talks with Meta over a cloud computing deal worth about $20 billion, adding to Meta's existing cloud providers. This deal would give Meta more power to train and run AI models and follows Oracle’s large contract with OpenAI.

xAI Reportedly Raising $10 Billion at $200 Billion Valuation: Elon Musk's xAI is reportedly raising $10 billion from investors, valuing the company at $200 billion, though Musk has denied the report. However, top executives, including co-founder Igor Babuschkin and former CFO Mike Liberatore, have left xAI after disputes over management and concerns about financial stability.

Meta Launches Super PAC to Combat AI Regulation: Meta founded the American Technology Excellence Project, a national super PAC backed by tens of millions of dollars, to push back against state-level tech and AI regulations, supporting candidates who promote US tech leadership and AI progress.

OpenAI Introduces ChatGPT Pulse: OpenAI is launching ChatGPT Pulse, a new feature for Pro mobile users that delivers daily personalized updates in a card-based feed, drawing on chat history, preferences, and connected apps. Pulse is designed to provide timely, relevant insights without constant prompting and aims to evolve into a proactive AI assistant.

Meta Ventures into Robotics with Project Metabot: Meta is investing heavily in robotics with Project Metabot, a software-driven initiative to dominate the platform layer for robotics. Andrew Bosworth revealed that Meta aims to solve dexterous manipulation and treat it as a hardware-agnostic, licensable platform.

Tencent Releases HunyuanImage 3.0, a Large Open-Source Text-to-Image Model: Tencent has released HunyuanImage 3.0, its largest open-source text-to-image model with 80B parameters, matching the quality of closed-source models, and handles long prompts, world knowledge, and text rendering inside images. The model is available on GitHub and Hugging Face.

Apple Testing ChatGPT-Style Chatbot Called Veritas: Apple is reportedly testing a new chatbot called Veritas internally to prepare for a major Siri upgrade planned for 2026. The tool lets staff start conversations, search personal data, and perform in-app actions like photo editing and messaging.

Stripe Developing Domain-Specific Foundation Model for Payments: Stripe is developing a payment-specific foundation model that converts transactions into vector embeddings, enabling applications such as fraud detection and authorization optimization. This model leverages the $1.4 trillion in annual transactions processed by Stripe to create a domain-specific AI tailored for the financial ecosystem.

Stripe's AI Strategy Focuses on AI Partnerships and Agent Commerce: Stripe is concentrating its AI strategy on four key investments: partnering with AI companies (currently serving two-thirds of Forbes AI 50), enabling agent commerce, integrating Stripe natively into AI developer tools, and deploying its foundation model across its network. This includes embedding payments directly into AI tools like Replit and Claude to facilitate seamless transactions.

Nike Utilizes AI for Personalized Customer Experience and Product Design: Nike is leveraging AI to personalize customer experiences through 3D foot modeling for optimal product recommendations and the 'Nike by You' customization platform. AI is also used in design and prototyping, such as the A.I.R. (Athlete Imagined Revolution) project, where prototypes are created with athletes' inputs, reducing prototyping time from months to hours.

Nike Employs AI in Supply Chain Management for Demand Prediction: Nike uses AI to predict demand changes based on location, preferences, sports seasons, and data from its various apps, including Nike, SNKRS, Nike Training Club, and Nike Run Club. This allows Nike to accurately forecast demand, moving away from reactive adjustments based solely on sales data.

Qwen Releases a Suite of AI Models Covering Perception, Speech, Translation, and Safety: Qwen launched a series of AI models, including Qwen3-TTS-Flash (text-to-speech), Qwen3-Omni (multimodal interface for text, image, audio, and video), Qwen-Image-Edit-2509 (image editing), Qwen3-VL (vision-language), Qwen3-LiveTranslate-Flash (low-latency interpretation), and Qwen3Guard (safety layer). This comprehensive release allows developers to build complete AI experiences without relying on third-party tools.

Meta FAIR CodeGen Team Introduces Code World Model (CWM) for Code Generation: Meta's FAIR CodeGen Team introduced CWM, a 32B parameter LLM trained on Python execution traces and Docker environments. CWM achieves strong results on code generation benchmarks and pioneers 'code world modeling' as a research testbed for reasoning, debugging, and planning in computational environments.

Google LearnLM Team Proposes AI-Augmented Textbook Personalization: Google's LearnLM Team proposed 'Learn Your Way,' an AI pipeline to personalize textbook content based on grade level and interests, transforming it into various formats (text, slides, audio, mind maps). A study showed improved retention scores compared to a standard digital reader.

OpenAI Launches ChatGPT Pulse for Proactive User Updates: OpenAI introduced ChatGPT Pulse, a feature that transforms ChatGPT from a reactive chatbot to a proactive assistant by conducting overnight research and delivering personalized daily updates. Available to Pro users on mobile, Pulse analyzes chat history, memory, and user feedback to provide actionable insights.

Google Releases Updated Gemini Models and Introduces Gemini Robotics 1.5: Google released updated versions of Gemini 2.5 Flash and 2.5 Flash-Lite, improving speed and cost efficiency for browser agent tasks, and launched Mixboard, an AI-powered concepting board with image editing. Gemini Robotics 1.5 introduces agentic capabilities for robots to learn across different forms and complete complex tasks.

NVIDIA Partners with OpenAI to Deploy 10 Gigawatts of NVIDIA Systems: NVIDIA and OpenAI announced a strategic partnership to deploy 10 gigawatts of NVIDIA systems for OpenAI's next-generation AI infrastructure, with NVIDIA investing up to $100 billion as capacity becomes available. The partnership ties NVIDIA's investment to deployment milestones, making them an infrastructure co-investor.

Google Updates Gemini Robotics, Veo, and More with Flash Pricing: Google released Gemini Robotics 1.5 with enhanced spatial and temporal reasoning, the latest Gemini Live, EmbeddingGemma, Veo 3 GA with API updates, AI Edge gallery, and Batch API embedding support.  Gemini 2.5 Flash also received a quality improvement while becoming 30% cheaper, offering more cost-effective performance.

Meta Introduces Code World Model (CWM) for Code Understanding: Meta launched Code World Model (CWM), an open-weights 32B model designed to understand code semantics through execution traces and agentic interactions like bug fixing and Docker runs. CWM boasts a 131k context window and demonstrates competitive coding metrics, along with strong math capabilities, and now supports Meta’s CWM on Apple silicon.

Cline Upgrades Code-Supernova Provider with 1M-Token Context: Cline quietly increased the context window of its "code-supernova" provider to 1 million tokens during the free alpha, enabling more extensive code analysis and generation capabilities. Cline also shipped a "workflow for building workflows" and facilitates pairing Qwen3-Coder with Cline + LM Studio for high-quality local coding.

Perplexity Builds Independent Web Index and Browsing API: Perplexity continues developing its alternative web index to Google and Microsoft and has released a browsing API for developers, with discover feed refresh scheduled to land next week on iOS first.  Developers have already begun integrating the API as a custom tool.
